notes: Risk treatment can create new risks or modify existing risks. Risk treatment that deals with negative consequences is sometimes referred to as risk mitigation, risk elimination, risk prevention or risk reduction. Risk treatment can involve avoiding the risk by deciding not to start or continue with the activity that gives rise to the risk; taking or increasing risk in order to pursue an opportunity; removing the risk source; changing the likelihood of harm or damage; changing the consequences; sharing the risk with another party or parties, including contracts and risk financing; or retaining the risk based on an informed decision.
